intro: Coccoloba ernstii, commonly known as the Trinidadian coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing on rocky substrates. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens.
